drupalNodeEvent.title: Global Views of China - CHERN China-Europe Research Highlights

field_speakers.processed: Richard Q. Turcsányi (Palacky University Olomouc), Tim Rühlig (Swedish Institute of International Relations), Una Aleksandra Bērziņa-Čerenkova (Rīga Stradiņš University), Jelena Gledić (University of Belgrade)

field_organizers.processed: China in Europe Research Network, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (Chair)

field_description.processed: The CHERN China-Europe research highlights – Global Views of China is a presentation of the Sinophone Borderlands project’s public opinion surveys conducted in 13 European countries. A series of large-scale representative surveys of public opinion investigating global views of China were conducted in the fall of 2020 in the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, Poland, UK, Germany, France, Spain, Italy, Sweden, Latvia, Serbia, and Russia. The head of the Palacky University Olomouc team that was in charge of the surveys, Richard Q. Turcsányi, will present the research and main findings, while team partners and CHERN members Tim Rühlig, Una Aleksandra Bērziņa-Čerenkova, and Jelena Gledić will introduce some interesting country-specific results.
